title: Understanding Ksp
text: The solubility product constant, Ksp, is a specific type of equilibrium constant. It is used to describe the equilibrium between a solid and its ions in a saturated solution.

title: Ksp and Solubility
text: Ksp is related to the solubility of a compound. A higher Ksp value indicates a more soluble compound, while a lower Ksp value indicates a less soluble compound.

hintAnswer: The equilibrium constant for the dissolution of a sparingly soluble ionic compound into its ions.
title: Identifying the Correct Definition
text: Which of the following best describes the solubility product constant, Ksp?
choices: The rate at which a solid dissolves in water.
The equilibrium constant for the dissolution of a sparingly soluble ionic compound into its ions.
The equilibrium constant for an $$acid-base$$ reaction.
The equilibrium constant for a redox reaction.
